snippet: Arab-Israeli participation in national elections has been declining for decades and growing frustration with Arab lawmakers’ focus on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict could further depress Arab turnout.
abstract: Arab-Israeli participation in Israel's national elections has been declining for decades and growing frustration with Arab lawmakers’ focus on Israeli-Palestinian conflict could further depress Arab turnout.

byline.contributor: Myra Noveck contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Arab-Israeli participation in national elections has been declining for decades and growing frustration with Arab lawmakers’ focus on the Israeli-Palestinian conflict could further depress Arab turnout.

headline.seo: Arab Apathy Raises Concerns About Israeli Democracy
headline.main: As Israeli Vote Nears, Arab Apathy Is a Concern
headline.print_headline: As Israeli Vote Nears, Arab Apathy Is a Concern
